text: The PS1 was on par with the N64 game library wise.  I had both systems and they both had amazing exclusive games with great gameplay.  Graphics were about even until the last couple years of each consoles' lifespan when the CD format allowed the PS1 to look better.  Xbox started the "Omg epic graphics, shitty/cookiecutter gameplay..." mentality that plagues the industry today.  I would say the last great system was the PS2 since people are still buying it today even with the 360 and PS3 out.

text:
That's true. The new stuff is awful. But I am currently applying to contribute to a fanproject called "Sonic 2 HD", where they try to make a HD version of Sonic 2, complete with new artwork, music and all.
I dunno, Mario's just nothing special for me. Of course, everything about Mario screams nostalgia and epicness to a wider public, much more than Sonic, but Sonic's just better for me personally because ... well, yeah. See above. :D
author: StrikeDaMic

text: yeah, in time. I had a Game Boy before I got a Genesis, but Mario never did it for me. Sonic was (and is still, in my opinion) way cooler than Mario.
author: StrikeDaMic

text: I dunno. I just replayed Sonic 2 + 3 on my PSP homebrew, and I was fighting with the Carnival Night zone. Went much easier than 15 years ago! Chemical Plant was so fast, sometimes I lost track of Sonic.
author: StrikeDaMic

text: You, sir, are epic win. Way before Mario, Sonic was the shit. Damn, I even went to carnival dressed up in a tailor-made sonic costume :D I know, I'm a sonic geek.
author: StrikeDaMic

text: Bout' time, I was beginning to think there wouldn't be any Sonic songs at all. Marble Zone is a good one but this song just personifies Sonic back in the 90's for me, good choice!
author: Toomnyusernae

text: Reminds me of playing this game when I was 4 and in the Boys and Girls Club.

text: sounds like an electric banjo.

text: The second zone of this level was such a bitch when I was young. Although this badass music always seemed to motivate me through it.

text:
One of my favorite levels in one of my favorite sonic games. ^-^

It's really easy to like this music. ^.^

text: This was always one of my favorite songs, even if I was never a fan of the series. I did play the first four games, and this one had some of the finest music I'd ever heard on the Genesis

text:
I can't think of a single track off-hand that I DIDN'T like from STH2. Some were better than others, certainly, but I don't think any are bad. 

Ending theme, Sky Chase, Final Boss, Emerald Hill next :P
